page.title: 06THE OCTOGON SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content: The main{Octogon Shopping Centre}was built in 1967 and covers 35 acres. It cost over 4 million pounds and consists of 70 shops, a{central bus {station, the Newland multi-storey car {park, a pedestrian precinct}and {offices.}From Oxford Street to Bull Lane, the shops are held up by pillars and shoppers are protected from the rain by overhead canopies. There are two storeys of shops under a domed roof. Part of{Murray's store}was knocked down early in 1985 and new smaller shops were built. The other part of Murray's has been boarded up and has a sign up for it to be rented. {Sainsbury's}is being moved to a larger site in Frogmore. The old shopping centre around the High Street now consists mainly of{estate agents}and {offices.
